tasks: Review the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com) and identify 3 areas where you can apply these principles to improve your UX Fundamentals score. Document your findings in a 1-page report.

Create a simple wireframe of a common user interface element (e.g., login form, search bar) using the 8-point grid system. Focus on creating a clear and consistent layout. Measure its usability using Hick's Law (lawsofux.com).
Write a short reflection (200-300 words) on how you can apply Occam's Razor to simplify your design decisions as a Strategic Lead.
Conduct a self-assessment of your current UX Fundamentals knowledge. Identify 5 areas where you need improvement and create a plan to address them. Document your plan in a 1-page report.
Redesign the navigation menu for your portfolio using the 8-point grid system. Focus on creating a clear and consistent layout. Measure its usability using Miller's Law (lawsofux.com).
Write a short case study (500-750 words) of a successful UX design project you've worked on in the past. Apply the Laws of UX to analyze your design decisions.
Create a simple prototype of a new feature using InVision or Figma. Focus on testing its usability using Hick's Law (lawsofux.com). Document your findings in a 1-page report.
Conduct 2 user interviews and document 5 pain points using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Analyze how these pain points can be addressed through UX design principles.
Write a short reflection (200-300 words) on how you can apply Occam's Razor to simplify your product thinking as a Strategic Lead.
Create a comprehensive UX strategy document for a new product feature. Apply the Laws of UX and the Jobs-to-be-Done framework to analyze user needs and design decisions.
Redesign your portfolio's navigation using the 8-point grid system. Focus on creating a clear and consistent layout. Measure its usability using Miller's Law (lawsofux.com).

Write a short case study (500-750 words) of a successful UX design project you've worked on in the past. Apply the Laws of UX to analyze your design decisions and document your findings in a 1-page report.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design decisions that shape the future of products and businesses. With your exceptional skills in UX Fundamentals, UI Craft & Visual Design, User Research & Validation, Product Thinking & Strategy, and Collaboration & Communication, you are poised to lead teams and deliver innovative solutions that exceed user expectations.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Hick's Law to Improve Navigation
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, understanding how the number of options affects user decision-making can inform design decisions and improve overall UX.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing websites that have been criticized for poor navigation and identify areas where Hick's Law is being violated. Propose 2 redesigns that address these issues, including clear and concise labeling and reduced number of options.

topics.name: Conducting Aesthetic-Usability Effect Research
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, recognizing the impact of aesthetics on user experience can inform design decisions and improve overall UX. This topic will help you understand how to apply this principle effectively.

topics.name: Developing a Product Strategy using Occam's Razor
topics.summary: As a Strategic Lead, applying Occam's Razor can help simplify product decisions and ensure alignment with business goals. This topic will help you develop a clear and concise strategy.
